basejump 0.6.4
  • Reference

Transmit Files from a Remote FTP Server

Source: R/transmit.R
transmit.Rd

Utility function that supports easy file matching and download from a remote FTP server. Also enables on-the-fly file renaming and compression.

transmit(remoteDir, localDir = ".", pattern, rename = NULL,
  compress = FALSE)

Arguments

remoteDir

string. Remote FTP directory path.
localDir

string. Directory where to save files locally.
pattern

string. Pattern to match against remote file names.
rename

string or NULL. Rename the local files (including suffix), if desired.
compress

boolean. gzip compress the files after download.

Value

Invisible character containing local file paths.

See also

Other Write Functions: assignAndSaveData, initializeDirectory, saveData, writeCounts

Examples

readme <- transmit(
    remoteDir = "ftp://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/release-90",
    pattern = "README",
    rename = "ensembl_readme.txt",
    compress = TRUE
)
#> Downloading ensembl_readme.txt.gz
basename(readme)
#> [1] "ensembl_readme.txt.gz"
file.exists(readme)
#> [1] TRUE

# Clean up
unlink("ensembl_readme.txt.gz")
